events.title: Wes Streeting warns of ‚Äòdisintegration‚Äô of rules-based world order after Venezuela attack
events.description: UK health secretary declines to criticise Donald Trump directly but suggests he is disturbed by events of recent days UK politics ‚Äì live updates Venezuela crisis ‚Äì live updates A senior British cabinet minister had warned of the ‚Äúdisintegration‚Äù of the international rules-based system in the aftermath of the US capture of the Venezuelan president, Nicol√°s Maduro, saying the instability poses a threat to Britain. Wes Streeting, the health secretary, declined to criticise Donald Trump directly and said that the prime minister, Keir Starmer, did not have the ‚Äúluxury of commentating‚Äù but suggested he was disturbed by the international picture, saying the rules-based order was ‚Äúcreaking at the seams‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: Security Council LIVE: ‚ÄòThe power of the law must prevail‚Äô amid Venezuela crisis, says Guterres
events.description: The Security Council met in emergency session in New York to address the US rendition of Venezuela‚Äôs President Nicol√°s Maduro from Caracas, a move that has sent shockwaves through the region and beyond. The UN chief Ant√≥nio Guterres told ambassadors there must be respect for national sovereignty, ‚Äúpolitical independence and territorial integrity,‚Äù after warning on Saturday that the US had set a ‚Äúdangerous precedent‚Äù for the world order. Follow the historic meeting live below from the UN Meetings Coverage team, and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: 6.2-magnitude earthquake jolts western Japan
events.description: The initial quake was followed by a sizable number of aftershocks. There was no tsunami warning issued and no immediate reports of injuries or major damage.

events.title: Anthony Joshua‚Äôs driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua‚Äôs driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and ‚Äúdriving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property‚Äù. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Massacre at Nigerian market leaves more than 30 dead as gunmen torch stalls, kidnap others
events.description: Armed attackers killed more than 30 people and kidnapped others during a violent market raid in Nigeria's Niger state, police said.

events.title: Drop draft proposals on death penalty for Palestinians, UN rights chief urges Israel
events.description: The UN‚Äôs top human rights official on Friday called on Israeli authorities to abandon plans for new legislation that would impose mandatory death sentences exclusively on Palestinians, warning the proposals violate international law and fundamental human rights standards.

events.title: Trump taking ‚Äòdrill, baby, drill‚Äô plan to Venezuela ‚Äòterrible‚Äô for climate, experts warn
events.description: ‚ÄòEverybody loses‚Äô if production supercharged in country with largest known oil reserves, critics say Donald Trump , by dramatically seizing Nicol√°s Maduro and claiming dominion over Venezuela ‚Äôs vast oil reserves, has taken his ‚Äú drill, baby, drill ‚Äù mantra global. Achieving the president‚Äôs dream of supercharging the country‚Äôs oil production would be financially challenging ‚Äì and if fulfilled, would be ‚Äúterrible for the climate‚Äù, experts say. Trump has aggressively sought to boost oil and gas production within the US. Now, following the capture and arrest of Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, he is seeking to orchestrate a ramp-up of drilling in Venezuela, which has the largest known reserves of oil in the world ‚Äì equivalent to some 300bn barrels, according to research firm the Energy Institute. Continue reading...

events.title: The ‚Äòterrorist‚Äô labelled leaders who warned of US oil aggression
events.description: These leaders argued that the true objective by the US is political domination and resource control.

events.title: WHO research shows COVID vaccines still crucial in preventing severe illness
events.description: Up-to-date vaccination remains the most effective way to prevent severe COVID-19 illness, new research from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows, even as the pandemic has officially ended.

events.title: Iran protests: UN warns against further bloodshed
events.description: As protests in the Iranian capital, Tehran ‚Äì sparked by increasing economic hardship and a cost-of-living crisis ‚Äì continued for a ninth day, the UN Secretary-General said he was ‚Äúdeeply saddened by the reported loss of life and injuries,‚Äù resulting from clashes between security forces and protesters.

events.title: At least nine Nigerian soldiers killed in bomb blast
events.description: Nigeria's myriad of security problems continues to pressure security forces. At least 9 soldiers were killed when their convoy struck a landmine before attackers opened fire on January 4. It happened in northeastern Borno state, the birthplace of Nigerian extremist group Boko Haram which has seen an uptick in militant attacks. FRANCE 24's Sam Olukoya tells us more straight from Abuja.

events.title: Health advances marked 2025 as wars and funding cuts strained systems
events.description: From eliminating deadly infections to expanding access to lifesaving vaccines, 2025 delivered meaningful progress for global health, according to the UN World Health Organization (WHO), offering cautious optimism at the close of a year marked by both breakthroughs and strain.

events.title: Colombian President Petro threatens military response after Trump warns Colombia may be next target
events.description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said Monday he would "take up arms" against the U.S. if it attacks his country. This after President Trump suggested Petro could be his next target.

events.title: Rubio vows to eliminate Hezbollah, Iran operations from Venezuela after Maduro capture
events.description: Hezbollah condemns U.S. capture of Nicolas Maduro as Secretary of State Marco Rubio vows to end the terrorist group's decades-long presence in Venezuela.

events.title: US raid on Venezuela ‚Äòundermined a fundamental principle of international law‚Äô, says UN rights body ‚Äì live
events.description: Spokesperson for UN high commissioner says ‚Äòaccountability for human rights violations cannot be achieved by unilateral military intervention‚Äô Deposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on Venezuela US foes and allies denounce Trump‚Äôs ‚Äòcrime of aggression‚Äô in Venezuela at UN meeting My colleague Sibylla Brodzinsky has reported on the relationship between the US and Colombia, home to significant oil reserves. Here is an extract from her story : Colombia has long been a close partner of the US in the fight against drug trafficking and enjoyed bipartisan support in Washington but relations have soured dramatically since Trump came to offic e. Colombia‚Äôs narcotics trade is largely controlled by illegal armed groups such as the Gulf Clan, the National Liberation Army (ELN) and dissident factions of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (Farc) guerrilla group, the majority of whose members demobilised after a 2016 peace deal ‚Ä¶ Continue reading...

events.title: NSW‚Äôs opposition is betting on fresh faces. It‚Äôs a good start ‚Äì but now the Coalition must decide what it stands for
events.description: Kellie Sloane renews shadow cabinet but there are challenges ahead on sensitive issues such as climate, forestry and national parks Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Since the Bondi massacre, New South Wales politicians ‚Äì unlike their federal colleagues ‚Äì have mostly put aside their differences to pass new, tougher gun laws and to mourn. But as the fog of grief lifts, NSW politics, known for its particularly robust style, is returning to business as usual. Continue reading...

events.title: Aid organisation warns of 'dire' conditions in Gaza, West Bank following Israeli ban
events.description: One of the humanitarian aid organisations affected by an Israeli ban from operating in Gaza and the West Bank says it is trying to negotiate with Israeli authorities to revoke the measure. Israel says the licences of the NGOs were removed after they refused to share full details of their staff. But Elsa Softic, deputy chief operations officer at Premi√®re Urgence Internationale, says her organisation has "serious concerns" about the new rules.

events.title: Man denies allegedly firebombing rabbi‚Äôs car bearing Hanukah sign in Melbourne
events.description: John Argento, 47, appeared in court charged with Christmas Day attack on car with a billboard reading ‚ÄòHappy Chanukah‚Äô Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A man accused of a Christmas arson attack on a car bearing a Hanukkah sign outside a rabbi‚Äôs home has declared his innocence. John Argento, of Richmond, faced Melbourne magistrates court on Tuesday after being charged with six counts of arson. Continue reading...

events.title: Cit√© Universitaire de Paris: The French campus that defies war
events.description: Every year, the Cit√© Internationale Universitaire de Paris welcomes around 12,000 residents from all backgrounds and nationalities. Students, researchers and artists live there side by side across its 47 campus houses, tucked away in a lush park in the south of Paris. The "Cit√© U", as locals call it, is celebrating a century of history, with its founding principles more relevant than ever.

events.title: At least 22 Ethiopian migrants killed in 'horrific' road crash
events.description: About 85 Ethiopian migrants were trying to leave the country when the accident occurred, authorities say.

events.title: Trump‚Äôs attack leaves China worried about its interests in Venezuela | Amy Hawkins
events.description: Maduro had just affirmed ‚Äòstrong bonds of brotherhood‚Äô with Beijing when US made its shocking intervention Venezuela crisis ‚Äì latest updates Hours before his life and the fate of his country was changed dramatically, Venezuela‚Äôs leader, Nicol√°s Maduro, was exchanging smiles and handshakes with a Chinese delegation in the presidential palace in Caracas. On Friday evening, shortly before he was seized by US forces , Maduro wrote on Telegram of his meeting with China‚Äôs special envoy for Latin American affairs, Qiu Xiaoqi: ‚ÄúA fraternal meeting that reaffirms the strong bonds of brotherhood and friendship between China and Venezuela. Through thick and thin!‚Äù Continue reading...

events.title: Swiss NYE fire: Bar had not been inspected for 5 years
events.description: A fire at the Le Constellation bar in the ski resort town of Crans-Montana killed 40 and injured 116 people on New Year's Eve. Swiss authorities have launched a criminal probe into the bar managers.

events.title: Are Trump's threats to Iran helping or harming protesters?
events.description: The US might hit Iran "very hard" if the regime escalates its crackdown on anti-government protesters, according to US President Donald Trump. How do Iranians feel about these warnings?

events.title: Swiss ski bar not inspected for five years before deadly fire, mayor says
events.description: The New Year's Eve fire at a bar in Crans-Montana killed 40 people and injured 116.

events.title: Iran offers citizens $7 monthly payments as protests spiral over economic crisis: report
events.description: Iran shifts from import subsidies to direct $7 monthly payments for citizens as the currency loses its value and protests intensify nationwide, according to reports.

events.title: Trial underway for former Uvalde school police officer accused of slow response to shooting
events.description: The trial of former Uvalde school police officer Adrian Gonzales, who is accused of not doing more to save lives in the 2022 massacre, is set to begin Tuesday.

events.title: Kyiv allies meet in Paris to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine
events.description: Ukraine's allies meet in Paris on ‚Å†January 6, seeking to finalise as much as possible their contributions to future security guarantees to reassure Kyiv in the event of a ceasefire with Russia. According to Reuters, a draft statement mentions binding commitments to support Ukraine in case of a future armed attack by Russia to restore peace and long-term military assistant. FRANCE 24's Clovis Casali is in Paris and tells us more.

events.title: Maduro seized, norms tested: Security Council divided as Venezuela crisis deepens
events.description: The UN Security Council met on Monday against a sharply altered diplomatic backdrop, following US strikes on the Venezuelan capital and seizure of President Nicol√°s Maduro.

events.title: Ukraine: Attacks disrupt heating as temperatures plunge
events.description: Recent attacks across Ukraine have killed civilians, damaged critical infrastructure and cut heating and power supplies for millions, UN humanitarians report, as temperatures drop below freezing.

events.title: How is gum arabic fuelling the war in Sudan?
events.description: Before war broke out, Sudan was the world‚Äôs biggest gum arabic exporter, with an estimated market share of 70-80%.

events.title: Venezuelan authorities detain more than a dozen international journalists
events.description: Venezuelan authorities detained more than a dozen international journalists Monday, a media advocacy group says. Most of them have since been released, but the move has members of the press concerned.

events.title: Guinea puts economic hope in new iron-ore mine
events.description: Guinea‚Äôs Simandou mine is one of the largest iron ore reserves in the world. Inaugurated at the end of last year it could, if properly run make a huge difference to the country's economy. Our correspondents report.

events.title: World News in Brief: Escalating violence in Sudan, civilian danger grows in Ukraine, Ethiopia aid cuts
events.description: In Sudan, civilians continue to bear the brunt of escalating violence, particularly in the Darfur and Kordofan regions.

events.title: Security Council: New faces, old tensions as five nations take their seats
events.description: From deploying peacekeepers to conducting quiet ‚Äì but at times heated ‚Äì diplomacy, the UN Security Council sits at the heart of global decision-making on war and peace. As of January, five new countries will have a seat around the iconic horseshoe table.

events.title: Who‚Äôs who in Maduro case: The judge, prosecutors and defense lawyers now facing off
events.description: Former Venezuela leader Nicolas Maduro appeared in federal court on narco-terrorism and drug trafficking charges after weekend capture by U.S. forces.

events.title: Iran protests prompt new Trump warning over deadly government crackdowns
events.description: Nine days of anti-government protests engulf Iran as Trump warns of consequences. Iranian Americans praise president's support for demonstrators.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: From elation to frustration: Trump snub wrongfoots Venezuela‚Äôs opposition
events.description: Some supporters of Mar√≠a Corina Machado still see path to power after US president refused to back her There was unbridled joy among members of Venezuela‚Äôs opposition on Saturday morning as their country‚Äôs president, Nicol√°s Maduro, was dragged into US custody after an audacious raid on his compound. ‚ÄúThe military strategy was brilliant,‚Äù said Ricardo Hausmann, a former minister and opposition supporter, said of the deadly nocturnal assault during which dozens of Maduro‚Äôs guards ‚Äì but not a single US soldier ‚Äì were reportedly killed. That elation was short-lived. Hours after Donald Trump announced Maduro‚Äôs capture during Operation Absolute Resolve, the US president dashed opposition hopes that their leader, the conservative activist Mar√≠a Corina Machado, would now be able to return home to inaugurate a new democratic era. Continue reading...

events.title: U.S. faces broad condemnation for actions in Venezuela during U.N. emergency meeting
events.description: During a U.N. Security Council emergency meeting, the U.S. called its intervention in Venezuela a law enforcement operation. Venezuela disagreed, calling the raid an illegitimate armed attack.

events.title: South Korea and China seek improved ties amid state visit
events.description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said he hoped for a "new phase" in ties with China during his state visit. Xi Jinping called for the countries to protect regional peace in a "more complex and turbulent" world.

events.title: Cuba says 32 Cuban officers were killed in US operation in Venezuela
events.description: Cuba has acknowledged the deaths of 32 Cubans in the American military operation that ousted Venezuela's leader over the weekend

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: What the U.S. raid in Venezuela means for countries like China and Russia
events.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Sarah Lenti, a former National Security Council director, what U.S. engagement in Venezuela means to other global players like China and Russia.

events.title: Ukraine's allies meet to discuss security as Trump's Greenland threat looms
events.description: Ukraine's allies will meet later today in Paris to discuss the country's security after a potential ceasefire with Russia.

events.title: Israel strikes multiple sites in Lebanon ahead of a key disarmament meeting
events.description: Israel's air force has struck areas in southern and eastern Lebanon, including Sidon, the country's third-largest city

events.title: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro‚Äôs narco case echoes US history of targeting alleged foreign drug kingpins
events.description: From Maduro to El Chapo: How the U.S. has pursued foreign leaders allegedly involved in international drug trafficking operations over the decades.

events.title: Iran anti-government protests spread to majority of provinces, videos show
events.description: Videos show that unrest has spread to more than 50 towns and cities, including pro-government heartlands.

events.title: Israeli FM visits Somaliland after world-first recognition storm
events.description: Gideon Saar is the first Israeli foreign minister to visit breakaway region since Israel recognised its independence.

events.title: What does the US raid in Venezuela mean for China‚Äôs designs on Taiwan?
events.description: Perception that Chinese-made weapons could not stop a ‚Äòdecapitation strike‚Äô may give Beijing pause for thought The sight of a hostile regional superpower launching an overnight raid to depose the leader of a smaller neighbouring country could easily have sent pulses in Taiwan racing. The US on Saturday revealed the details of a surprise raid to capture Venezuela‚Äôs leader, Nicol√°s Maduro , who was whisked away to the US, where he was frogmarched into a court in New York on Monday . Continue reading...

events.title: Protester detained in Sydney for wearing ‚Äòglobalise the intifada‚Äô jacket says she should ‚Äònever have been arrested‚Äô
events.description: Woman, 53, claims police told her slogan was unlawful despite being unable to point to legislation banning its use Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A protester detained in Sydney‚Äôs CBD while wearing a jacket that said ‚Äúglobalise the intifada‚Äù says she should ‚Äúnever have been arrested‚Äù and claims police told her the slogan was unlawful, despite them being unable to point to legislation banning its use. The 53-year-old woman was arrested on Sunday during a protest against the US military intervention in Venezuela for wearing a shirt ‚Äúdisplaying offensive messaging‚Äù, police alleged. Continue reading...

events.title: NSW ministers warned not to meet alone with prominent lobbyist after firm placed on watchlist
events.description: Eamonn Fitzpatrick, a former media adviser to several Labor premiers and prime ministers, says he ‚Äòself-reported two genuine errors‚Äô and rectified the lobbyist register immediately Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast New South Wales ministers have been warned not to meet alone with one of the most prominent lobbyists in the state, Eamonn Fitzpatrick, or his firm after the NSW Electoral Commission placed EJF Advisory on a watchlist for breaches of the lobbying code. The NSW lobbyist register showed the firm was placed on a watchlist from 13 November 2025 ‚Äúdue to contraventions of the Lobbyists Code of Conduct or the Lobbying of Government Officials Act 2011 (Logo Act)‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: NATO could end if US takes over Greenland ‚Äî Danish PM
events.description: Denmark's Mette Frederiksen said "everything would stop" in the event of a US attack on another NATO country. European leaders have backed Frederiksen while saying the US "is an essential partner."

events.title: Louvre ticket price hike: Necessary or discriminatory?
events.description: üá´üá∑ üñºÔ∏è üéüÔ∏è If you plan to visit the Louvre January 14 onwards and come from a non-EU country, be prepared to shell out a pretty penny, with the museum's ticket prices going up by almost 50%. üó£Ô∏è The Louvre's management has said the move is necessary, while some critics have called the plan discriminatory. ü§î So, which one is it? FRANCE 24's Tanishk Saha takes a closer look.

events.title: Greece says a radio failure that grounded flights is unlikely to be a cyberattack
events.description: Greece‚Äôs government says a major radio communications failure that shut the country‚Äôs airspace is unlikely to have been a cyberattack

events.title: Yemen aid response buckling under funding cuts as needs keep rising
events.description: Yemen‚Äôs already fragile humanitarian response is being pushed to breaking point by deep funding shortfalls, the UN warned in an update Sunday highlighting mounting risks for millions across the country.

events.title: ‚ÄòDo not give up on children‚Äô: Displaced by violence, a Haitian girl finds hope at school
events.description: A teenage Haitian girl who was forced to flee her home in Haiti‚Äôs capital, Port-au-Prince, due to gang violence has urged adults not to ‚Äúgive up on children.‚Äù

events.title: Venezuela orders nationwide manhunt for supporters after Maduro's arrest by US forces
events.description: Nicolas Maduro was arrested by U.S. forces on drug trafficking charges as Venezuela declares emergency, ordering arrests of supporters. Rodriguez sworn in.

events.title: Macron hosts Ukraine and allies to try to cement security guarantees
events.description: The talks are held as Russia continues attacking Ukraine's energy sector and under the shadow of US threats to annex Greenland.

events.title: Ukraine‚Äôs top allies meet in Paris to push for Kyiv‚Äôs security guarantees
events.description: 'Coalition of the willing' tries to lay groundwork for ceasefire and end to Russia's nearly four-year war in Ukraine.

events.title: Berlin blackout: How dangerous are left‚Äëwing extremists?
events.description: A left‚Äëwing extremist group has claimed responsibility for an attack on a Berlin power plant. What drives such an attack, and how serious a threat does this radical network pose?

events.title: European leaders push back on Trump's wish to take over Greenland ahead of Ukraine talks
events.description: Key European allies of Ukraine and top US envoys meet President Volodymyr Zelensky in Paris on January 6 in their latest bid to agree security guarantees for any ceasefire in Russia's war against its neighbour. At the same time, several attending European leaders pushed back on U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs comments seeking an American takeover of Greenland, reaffirming the strategic, mineral-rich Arctic island ‚Äúbelongs to its people.‚Äù FRANCE 24's Clovis Casali tells us more from the Elys√©e palace in Paris.

events.title: Swiss officials admit safety inspections lapse at bar where 40 died in NYE fire
events.description: Swiss authorities on Tuesday said that fire safety inspections had not been carried out since 2019 at Le Constellation bar in the Swiss Alpine ski resort of Crans-Montana where 40 people died and 116 where injured in a New Year's Eve blaze. The law requires the municipal fire department to conduct annual inspections in establishments open to the public.

events.title: Trump: We need to take Greenland - right now
events.description: Donald Trump has doubled down on his territorial ambitions for Greenland - despite warnings that his plans for the Danish territory could destroy NATO.

events.title: Trump is likely gambling he could get away with Greenland grab as NATO needs US more than he needs it
events.description: It is becoming increasingly clear that Donald Trump is serious about taking Greenland from Denmark, a NATO ally, despite warnings that such a move would destroy the alliance.

events.title: Sparkler candles banned by Swiss mayor after New Year's bar fire killed 40
events.description: The Swiss bar that caught fire during a New Year's celebration and killed 40 people had not been inspected since 2019, officials have said.

events.title: 'Breakthrough' blood test at home could help more people spot Alzheimer's, says study
events.description: A new "breakthrough" blood test can help spot the key warning signs of Alzheimer's, latest research suggests.

events.title: Swiss police identify all 116 people injured in deadly New Year's bar fire
events.description: Swiss police say they've identified all the people who were injured in the fire that tore through a New Year‚Äôs celebration in a crowded bar

events.title: Off-duty deputy shot and killed while working security job in Texas, suspect apprehended
events.description: Off-duty Caldwell County deputy shot and killed while working security at a nightclub in Austin, Texs. Police investigation ongoing.

events.title: Trump Greenland takeover would end NATO, Denmark asserts
events.description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen warns that President Donald Trump's Greenland annexation threats could end NATO, saying military action against ally would stop security alliance formed after WWII.

events.title: Nestle issues global recall of some baby formula products over toxin fears
events.description: The food giant discovered some batches of SMA infant and follow-on formula could lead to vomiting

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Anger in Papua New Guinea after Starlink ordered to shut down internet services
events.description: In mid-December PNG said the company did not have a licence to operate in the country and ordered it to halt operations Frustration is growing in Papua New Guinea weeks after the government ordered Starlink to shut down operations in the country as businesses, health providers and communities struggle without access to internet services. Starlink, owned by Elon Musk‚Äôs SpaceX, is a satellite internet company that provides internet to remote places. In mid-December, the National Information and Communications Technology Authority (Nicta) ordered the company to halt operations because it was not licensed in PNG. Continue reading...

events.title: US operation in Venezuela marks a 'geopolitical shift'
events.description: European leaders have given a low-key response to US President Donald Trump's military intervention in Venezuela as they try to get Trump to help end Russia's war on Ukraine. Venezuela's traditional allies are also in a bind to criticise the US intervention: Russia has to way up the cost of losing a key regional ally against maintaining good relations with Trump which it can then use against Ukraine. FRANCE 24's Andrew Hilliar breaks it down for us

events.title: Pakistani counterterrorism police seize 2 tons of explosives and arrest 3 in Karachi
events.description: Pakistani counterterrorism police have raided militant hideouts in Karachi, arresting three suspects and seizing about 2 tons of explosives

events.title: A woman dies from cervical cancer every two minutes, UN says
events.description: A flood of questions drowned Jeanette in thought after she was diagnosed with cervical cancer. Would she be unable to conceive a child? Would she have to enter menopause at the early age of 31?

events.title: Progress for Ukraine talks in Paris uncertain with U.S. focus shifting to Venezuela
events.description: Ukraine's allies are meeting Tuesday in Paris for key talks that could help determine the country's security after a potential ceasefire with Russia. But prospects for progress are uncertain.

events.title: After Venezuela, can the EU protect Greenland from the US?
events.description: Donald Trump's claims on Greenland are worrying Europe once again. After the US attack on Venezuela, concerns are growing over how far Washington might go ‚Äî and if the EU has any real tools to defend Danish territory.

events.title: Battle of the Sexes 'brought eyes on tennis'
events.description: Women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka defends the 'Battle of the Sexes' match against Nick Kyrgios after opening her season with a crushing win in Brisbane.

events.title: Economic survival in Gaza decimated by Israeli counts on small initiatives
events.description: Gaza's unemployment rate has reached 80 percent, among the highest in the world, according to the United Nations.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer Fran√ßois Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world‚Äôs oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won't travel to India
events.description: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Nvidia unveils self-driving car tech as it seeks to power more products with AI
events.description: The chip giant is looking for ways to move the AI revolution beyond software and into physical products.

events.title: Maduro says he‚Äôs a ‚Äòprisoner of war‚Äô: Why that matters
events.description: Prisoners of war have rights that Maduro isn't being afforded at present.

events.title: Live: Deadly clashes erupt between Syrian army, SDF forces in Aleppo
events.description: At least four people killed after clashes erupted between the Syrian army and the Kurdish-led forces in Aleppo.

events.title: How is gum arabic fuelling the war in Sudan?
events.description: Gum arabic is used in many everyday items, from food to paint, yet researchers say it is playing a role in Sudan‚Äôs war.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Venezuela: Germany hesitates to condemn US attack
events.description: The German government seems to have three things on its mind in regard to US capture of of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro: be cautious, wait and see and don't upset Donald Trump.

events.title: Maduro says he is 'prisoner of war' - as Trump reacts to 'extraordinary' court hearing
events.description: Nicolas Maduro's arraignment was an "extraordinary moment in history", US President Donald Trump has said, as the deposed Venezuelan leader made his first court appearance since being captured.

events.title: Ukraine did not attack Putin's residence, says Trump
events.description: Donald Trump has said Ukraine did not target a residence belonging to Russian leader Vladimir Putin in an apparent drone attack.

events.title: New year dawns amid rubble and resolve in Gaza
events.description: As 2026 begins, residents of the Gaza Strip are confronting life in displacement camps and among the ruins of destroyed neighbourhoods ‚Äì facing deep uncertainty after months of war and devastation.

events.title: Missing 4-year-old Florida boy found dead after massive 3-day search in Alabama woods
events.description: Tragic end to search as 4-year-old Florida boy missing in Alabama woods found dead after wandering from family property during holiday visit to relatives.

events.title: Ohio police hunt killer after dentist, wife found shot to death with children safe inside home: timeline
events.description: Manhunt underway after dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique found shot dead in their Columbus home. Two young children discovered safe at the scene.

events.title: Teen girl vanishes from South Carolina home, police fear she's in serious danger after monthlong search
events.description: Missing teen Mackenzie Dalton, 16, disappeared from South Carolina home in late November. Police believe blonde teen is in danger due to her age.

events.title: Pilot dies alongside 3 nieces on wedding day in tragic Arizona helicopter crash
events.description: Tragic helicopter crash kills pilot and his three nieces on his wedding day. Family devastated as celebratory flight turns deadly in remote canyon.

events.title: Venezuela's new interim leader Delcy Rodr√≠guez 'hates the West,' ex official warns
events.description: Venezuela's new interim president Delcy Rodr√≠guez represents continuity of Maduro's regime, according to a former official as the 56-year-old faces U.S. sanctions.

events.title: Cuba's shadow in Venezuela: Havana‚Äôs intelligence and military ties exposed after Maduro raid
events.description: Cuba confirms 32 intelligence personnel killed in U.S. operation that seized Maduro, exposing extensive Cuban involvement in Venezuela's military systems.

events.title: Maduro capture echoes Noriega takedown that used rock music as psychological warfare against dictator
events.description: Nicol√°s Maduro's capture in Venezuela draws striking parallels to the dramatic 1989 U.S. operation that brought down Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega.

events.title: Zelensky replaces Ukraine's powerful security service chief
events.description: The Ukrainian president has come under heavy criticism for his reshuffling of one the country's most successful security agencies.

events.title: How US statements on Venezuela shifted, from drugs to oil
events.description: For months, US officials pushed the story that Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro was the head of a drug cartel.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Guinea‚Äôs junta chief elected president after opposition boycott
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya reneged on promise not to stand and hand west African country back to civilian rule The head of Guinea‚Äôs junta, Mamady Doumbouya, who had pledged not to run for office after seizing power four years ago, has been elected president after the country‚Äôs electoral commission said he had secured a sweeping majority of the vote. Doumbouya, 41, faced eight rivals for the presidency but the main opposition leaders were barred from running and had urged a boycott of the vote held over the weekend. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuelan expats celebrate Maduro's arrest, but question their country's future
events.description: In Florida, members of the Venezuelan community celebrate -- and question -- the U.S. detention of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

events.title: An inside look at Venezuela's critical gold trade
events.description: Gold -- like oil -- is crucial for Venezuela's government. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with CNN journalist Isa Soares, who won an Emmy for her coverage of the gold trade in the country.

events.title: Malaysia pledges anti-corruption campaign amid 1MDB anger
events.description: Malaysia is gearing up for major reforms following the latest verdict against ex-PM Najib Razak over the 1MDB corruption scandal. Aggressive anti-graft moves, however, could also sink the country's current government.

events.title: Germany news: Merz issues business SOS in letter to allies
events.description: Chancellor Merz has told coalition politicians the situation in several key German businesses is "very critical." He said the government must prioritize improving areas like energy and labor costs in 2026. Follow DW.

events.title: Will Prague keep the Czech crown (and cash) ‚Äî forever?
events.description: The new government in Prague wants to change the constitution to anchor the Czech crown as the country's legal tender and guarantee the right to use cash, not just cards. Why has it made this pledge and will it happen?

events.title: Ukraine updates: European leaders, US envoys meet in Paris
events.description: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, NATO chief Rutte and Trump's envoys Witkoff and Kushner are joining a "Coalition of the Willing" meeting in the French capital on solidifying security guarantees. More on DW.

events.title: Smiles all around as snow falls in Paris
events.description: Despite bone-chilling temperatures and disruptions to public transport, tourists and Parisians alike took to the streets of the French capital Monday to experience snowfall in Paris.

events.title: Zelenskyy replaces Ukraine's security chief and hires a Canadian economic adviser
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has replaced the head of the country's security service as part of a top-level reshuffle

events.title: Venezuela's people must be heard, insists UN human rights chief
events.description: Responding to the seizure of Venezuela President Nicolas Maduro by the United States, UN human rights chief Volker T√ºrk on Tuesday reiterated deep concerns that the military operation undermined fundamental protections for sovereign countries.

events.title: UN chief deeply concerned over ‚Äòpossible intensification of instability‚Äô in Venezuela
events.description: Invoking the bedrock principle prohibiting the use of force against the territory and independence of any State, the UN Secretary-General told the Security Council on Monday there must be ‚Äúfull respect‚Äù for the UN Charter, in the face of the United States military intervention in Venezuela and seizure of President Nicol√°s Maduro.

events.title: Captured Venezuelan dictator Maduro pleads not guilty before judge cuts off outburst
events.description: Dethroned Venezuelan dictator Nicolas Maduro faces arraignment in New York federal court Monday on drug trafficking charges after dramatic U.S. capture.

events.title: Maduro and 'Lady Macbeth‚Äô Cilia Flores marriage spells 'worst case' custody scenario
events.description: Venezuelan leader Nicol√°s Maduro and Cilia Flores face "worst-case scenario" in U.S. custody according to expert, with federal indictments on drug and weapons charges.

events.title: Mexican president rejects US sending troops to her country: 'I don't believe in an invasion'
events.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum condemns U.S. intervention in Venezuela, defends sovereignty amid Trump pressure over cartels and potential military action.

events.title: North Korea test-launches hypersonic missile system in front of Kim, nation says
events.description: Kim Jong Un oversaw hypersonic missile tests as North Korea ramped up weapons displays ahead of a major political conference, state media reported.

events.title: European allies back Denmark over Trump's threat to annex Greenland
events.description: Donald Trump has refused to rule out using force to annex Greenland - a scenario that would spell the end of Nato, according to Denmark.

events.title: Which countries could be in Trump's sights after Venezuela?
events.description: Trump has made numerous threats against other nations in Washington's orbit.

events.title: Swiss bar hit by deadly New Year‚Äôs fire had no safety checks in five years
events.description: Swiss authorities say fire safety inspections had not been carried out at the bar in Crans-Montana since 2019.

events.title: Qatar slams ‚Äòpolitical blackmail‚Äô as Israel hinders Gaza‚Äôs Rafah crossing
events.description: Humanitarian groups say Israeli restrictions continue to hamper aid deliveries, a clear violation of ceasefire.

events.title: US ‚Äòadapt, shrink or die‚Äô terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (¬£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as ‚Äúbold and ambitious‚Äù by the UN but could be the ‚Äúnail in the coffin‚Äù in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington‚Äôs political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela: 'Regime change' not the plan, say US Republicans
events.description: House speaker Mike Johnson has said US troops are not expected to deploy to Venezuela. Meanwhile, gunfire briefly broke out by the presidential palace in Caracas overnight, witnesses said. Follow the latest.

events.title: India: Supreme Court denies bail to Muslim student activists
events.description: Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam have been in detention for more than five years without a full trial or conviction. They're accused of playing a "central role" in stoking the communal riots in Delhi in early 2020.

events.title: Five die in weather accidents in France as cold snap grips Europe
events.description: Five people in France died in weather related incidents as ice and snow swept across swathes of Europe for a second day on Tuesday. Below-freezing temperatures caused flight and train cancellations in the Netherlands, the UK and France and brought dangerous conditions for drivers.

events.title: British teenager confirmed dead after Swiss bar fire - as all 40 victims are identified
events.description: A teenager with British citizenship has been confirmed dead after a fire at a bar in Switzerland - as officials say all 40 victims have been identified.

events.title: Iran has been shaken by a series of protests over the past 50 years. Here's a look at them
events.description: Over the past 50 years, Iran has been shaken by a series of protests

events.title: Snow and ice wreak havoc across Europe, causing deadly accidents and travel chaos
events.description: Snow, ice and freezing temperatures have hit parts of Europe, causing chaos

events.title: Mexico dismisses US military intervention despite Trump's threats after Venezuela operation
events.description: President Donald Trump has again raised the idea of acting against Mexican drug cartels, but Mexico and analysts doubt unilateral U.S. military action

events.title: Gaza aid lifelines under strain as winter worsens
events.description: Humanitarian partners in the Gaza Strip are struggling to reach hundreds of thousands of vulnerable people as winter storms batter damaged homes and temporary shelters.

events.title: Chicago Teachers Union promotes Venezuela regime change protests organized by socialist groups
events.description: Chicago Teachers Union promotes Venezuela protest organized by socialist groups after Maduro's capture. Coalition demands end to aggression.

events.title: UK confirms joint airstrike targeting suspected ISIS weapons facility in Syria
events.description: British and French aircraft struck an underground ISIS facility in Syria believed to be used for weapons storage. RAF Typhoon jets targeted the site north of Palmyra.

events.title: Israel's foreign minister on historic visit to Somaliland
events.description: In a controversial move, Israel became the first nation to acknowledge Somaliland as an independent state.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Weather tracker: Arctic air grips Europe as severe winds batter Corsica
events.description: Subzero temperatures, heavy snowfall and powerful gusts mark a harsh start to 2026 for many It has been a cold start to the year across much of Europe, particularly in central regions, where temperatures dropped to double-digit negatives. Heavy snowfall hit parts of eastern and central Europe on New Year‚Äôs Eve, notably in Poland and Ukraine, with similar conditions across the Alps on the first few days of the year. The cold is likely to continue this week as an Arctic air mass sinks south across Europe, pulling temperatures well below the seasonal average outside south-east Europe. Temperatures are expected to fall widely by about 5C (41F) below average, with some areas ‚Äì such as parts of central and north-eastern Europe ‚Äì up to 10C lower than the norm. When wind chill is taken into account, it will feel even colder. Continue reading...

events.title: ‚ÄòWon‚Äôt go down without a fight‚Äô: Moira Deeming among Victorian Liberal MPs facing preselection challenge
events.description: Exclusive: Western metropolitan region MP to battle Dinesh Gourisetty ahead of November state election as Ann-Marie Hermans also challenged Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Victorian Liberal upper house MPs Moira Deeming and Ann-Marie Hermans are to face preselection challenges, as senior party members sound out a former journalist to run against Renee Heath. Guardian Australia has confirmed from three sources not authorised to comment publicly that Dinesh Gourisetty, a prominent figure in Melbourne‚Äôs fast-growing Indian community, will nominate for preselection in the western metropolitan region against Deeming. Continue reading...

events.title: Capture of Maduro by US means Russia, Iran and China lose key ally
events.description: Nicolas Maduro's allies have been particularly vocal in their condemnation of the US' capture of the deposed Venezuelan leader. Among them are Russia, Iran and China. US control of oil reserves in Venezuela would mean the United States could control the market, and therefore prices - something worrying oil-producing countries as prices are already running low.

events.title: Palestinian embassy in London opens in 'historic moment'
events.description: The Embassy of the state of Palestine has officially opened in the UK, marking what the Palestinian ambassador to London hailed as a "historic moment".

events.title: US actions in Venezuela ‚Äòconstitute a dangerous precedent‚Äô: Guterres
events.description: The UN Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres has said he is ‚Äúdeeply alarmed‚Äù over the standoff between the United States and Venezuela in recent months, which culminated on Saturday morning in the capture of President Nicol√°s Maduro by US special forces.

events.title: Results expected 5 January after landmark elections in Central African Republic
events.description: Voting proceeded largely as planned in the Central African Republic‚Äôs first-ever combined presidential, legislative, regional and municipal elections, and ballot counting is now complete, the UN peacekeeping mission (MINUSCA) said on Wednesday, with results expected to be announced on 5 January.

events.title: University of Illinois hosted state-funded committee meeting where professors advocated for reparations
events.description: University of Illinois professors advocate for collective reparations at Illinois meeting, calling for community payments beyond individual compensation.

events.title: Latin America fractures over Trump‚Äôs Maduro capture as regional allies shift right
events.description: Latin American nations split over Venezuela's Maduro capture as regional summit fails to reach consensus, exposing a new shift to the right across the Western Hemisphere.

events.title: Gaza waits as reports suggest Rafah crossing may reopen
events.description: Palestinians in Gaza have told Al Jazeera they are cautiously optimistic after hearing the Rafah crossing could reopen.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Ros√© used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Tunisian activists fight for communities for access to water amidst shortage
events.description: Tunisian communities are increasingly frustrated that access to drinking water is still not a given, particulalry for rural communities. Hundreds of thousands of people are thought not to be connected to distribution networks at all. To make matters worse: some live next to the very dams that supply bigger cities. Our team reports.

events.title: Back to textbooks: Denmark rolls back digital learning
events.description: Denmark has long been hailed as a digital champion, with online public services, digital IDs and tablets in schools as early as 2011. But authorities are now shifting course in the education and social sectors, following alarming figures on children‚Äôs mental health and school performance. A massive return to analogue life is underway: mobile phones are banned in schools and after-school clubs, a return to pre-digital learning is being rolled out and social media will soon be banned for anyone under 15. Our team reports from Copenhagen.

events.title: Suspect in Vance home vandalism has had multiple run-ins with the law, demanded to be called Julia
events.description: A man accused of vandalizing Vice President JD Vance's Cincinnati home demanded to be called "Julia" when arrested. The suspect has a history of mental health issues.

events.title: Harvard president criticizes faculty activism, claims university bringing objectivity back to classroom
events.description: Harvard president criticizes faculty activism in classrooms, saying it creates fear among students to speak freely on controversial issues and topics.

events.title: Israel shuts door on Turkey in Gaza as Trump praises Erdogan, plays down clash
events.description: Israel is blocking any Turkish military role in Gaza as President Donald Trump praises Turkey's president and works to manage rising tensions over Gaza, Syria and other issues in region.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Egypt makes it to AFCON's quarter-finals after beating Benin
events.description: Mohamed Salah sealed Egypt's win against Benin and sent it through the quarter-finals on January 5. Egypt, which has played every game in Agadir, will stay in the coastal city for a quarterfinal on Saturday against Burkina Faso or defending champion Ivory Coast, who are meeting January 6. FRANCE 24's Harold Girard tells us more ahead of the game.

events.title: Harbin ice festival draws sculptors and spectators to northern China, in photos
events.description: Sculptors converged over the weekend on the frigid northern Chinese city of Harbin for the annual Ice and Snow Festival, as families traveled from afar to admire the towering ice sculptures and some visitors braved the cold with winter swimming. This is a photo gallery curated by AP photo editors.

events.title: Trump claims US oil firms could be 'up and running' in Venezuela within 18 months
events.description: Trump is open about his ambitions for scaled-up US operations, but analysts say such plans would take time.

events.title: Self-proclaimed hypnotherapist on trial in France for drugging and raping women
events.description: Cyril Zattara is charged with raping 14 women over a decade, as well as secretly filming others.

events.title: Central African Republic president  wins third term by landslide
events.description: The main opposition coalition boycotted the vote after a referendum allowed the removal of term limits.

events.title: Dance music festival Tomorrowland to hold three-day event in Thailand
events.description: Founded 20 years ago, Tomorrowland has grown into one of the most iconic celebrations of electronic music.

events.title: Indian gang rape survivor back home after a week in hospital
events.description: The 26-year-old was taken to hospital with serious head and facial injuries and several fractures.

events.title: Netflix pulls Chinese drama after Vietnam's outcry over disputed map
events.description: An episode in the drama Shine on Me features a map depicting contested claims in the South China Sea.

events.title: Canada's Chrystia Freeland to quit as MP and become adviser to Zelensky
events.description: Freeland says she will exit parliament in "the coming weeks" as she becomes an economic development adviser for Kyiv.

events.title: Selfies and smiles: South Korea seeks 'new phase' in ties with China
events.description: South Korea's Lee Jae Myung snapped selfies with China's Xi Jinping as he pursues better ties with China in a four-day visit.

events.title: Cuba defiant as it braces for post-Maduro era
events.description: The prospects for Cuba - a close ally of Nicol√°s Maduro's Venezuela - are now bleak, writes the BBC's Will Grant.

events.title: Congress‚Äôs role questioned as Democrats vow to rein in Trump on Venezuela
events.description: Legislative efforts to check Trump's military authority on Venezuela falter amidst partisan divides in the US Congress.

events.description: Who decides what‚Äôs true in the digital age?

events.description: Al Jazeera looks at five potential favourites tipped to lead Man United after Ruben Amorim's sacking as manager.

events.description: Delcy Rodriguez becomes Venezuela‚Äôs interim leader after Maduro‚Äôs kidnapping, balancing domestic pressure and US demands

events.title: What to know about Trump‚Äôs plan on Venezuela
events.description: After US forces abducted Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, it is unclear what Washington has planned.

events.title: Can China and South Korea reset complex ties after Xi-Lee summit?
events.description: Analysts say both countries increasingly rely on each other for economic and security reasons amid geopolitical churn.

events.title: Jewish activist kicked out of Bondi vigil over keffiyeh
events.description: Jewish activist kicked out of Bondi vigil over keffiyeh

events.title: ‚ÄòClosing his eyes‚Äô: Why is Russia‚Äôs Putin quiet on US abduction of Maduro?
events.description: Russia's leader will seek to benefit from Washington's intervention but will also worry he could be next, experts say.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil

events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship ‚Äî and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news

events.title: Maduro‚Äôs legal team includes acclaimed lawyer who represented Julian Assange
events.description: Barry Pollack, a US trial lawyer, will take on the case as the captured Venezuelan president‚Äôs private counsel When Nicol√°s Maduro appeared in court in New York on Monday, his choice of lawyer quickly raised eyebrows. The captured Venezuelan president was accompanied by Barry Pollack, a top-tier US trial lawyer who spent years representing Julian Assange , eventually securing the WikiLeaks founder‚Äôs release from prison in the UK in 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Tuna King' pays record ¬£2.4m for giant bluefin at Tokyo auction
events.description: Kiyoshi Kimura will turn prized 243kg fish into sushi rolls selling for ¬£2.4o at his restaurant chain A sushi entrepreneur has paid a record 510.3m yen (¬£2.4m) for a giant bluefin tuna at a prestigious auction in Tokyo‚Äôs main fish market. Kiyoshi Kimura, who styles himself the ‚ÄúTuna King‚Äù, paid the top price for the 243kg (536lbs) specimen, which was caught off Japan‚Äôs northern coast. Continue reading...

events.title: Lawmakers split over Maduro's seizure. And, CDC cuts childhood vaccine schedule
events.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicol√°s Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine recommendations at President Trump's direction.

events.title: The criminal prosecution of Nicol√°s Maduro is underway. Here's what to expect
events.description: Now begins what could be a lengthy legal process of pretrial motions, potential plea negotiations and possibly a jury trial of the authoritarian leader who ruled Venezuela for more than a decade.

events.title: Danish prime minister says a US takeover of Greenland would mark the end of NATO
events.description: Her comments came in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed call for the strategic, mineral-rich Arctic island to come under U.S. control in the aftermath of the weekend military operation in Venezuela.

events.title: A $400,000 profit on Maduro's capture raises insider trading questions on Polymarket
events.description: Online sleuths have tried to uncover who placed a winning bet on the Venezuelan leader's arrest to no avail. Still, prediction market watchers say the bet appears suspicious.

events.title: Uganda 2026 election: What you need to know
events.description: Voters in Uganda go to the polls on January 15 to elect a new president and members of parliament. DW breaks down the key facts you need to know ahead of the crucial vote.

events.title: Central African Republic: Touadera secures third term
events.description: President Faustin Archange Touadera has secured a third term, though the main opposition coalition boycotted the presidential election. Touadera is one of Russia's closest allies in Africa.

events.title: Germany: Alcohol prices well below EU average
events.description: Alcohol is cheaper in Germany than many other EU countries, with consumption still relatively high. However, there has been a fall in the amount that people, particularly young people and men, are drinking.

events.title: Venezuela's interim president: Who is Delcy Rodriguez?
events.description: Those who had hoped for Nobel Peace Prize laureate Maria Corina Machado to lead Venezuela were disappointed: The US and Donald Trump are going with former vice president Rodriguez.

events.title: Can Germany escape its economic slump in 2026?
events.description: The German economy desperately needs a boost in 2026 after years of downturn. Yet despite massive government spending pledges, optimism is fading among economists.

events.title: Follow live: Trump speaks about US intervention in Venezuela
events.description: No description available.

events.title: UK bans junk food ads to fight childhood obesity
events.description: In an effort to combat childhood obesity, the United Kingdom has banned daytime TV and online ads that promote junk food. The health ministry says this could recede by 20,000 the number of children living with obesity. But some health advocates say the measures dont go far enough, as outside advertising and brands are still allowed as long as the unhealthy food is not shown.

events.title: Galette des rois: What is the French traditional king cake?
events.description: After all the sweet treats of the holidays, France has one more in store: la galette des rois or King Cake. Throughout the month of January, but especially on January 6 for Epiphany or Three Kings' Day, people head to the bakery to buy one. Eug√©nie Pont from the magazine Fou de P√¢tisserie tells us everything you need to know about this delicious French tradition.

events.title: Buy a king's cake, win a car: French tradition with a twist
events.description: Today is a special day for all those with a sweet tooth in France. All throughout the month of January, but especially today on the 6th of January, or the Epiphany, French people buy a 'galette des rois', or a kings' cake. And some bakeries are finding incentives to get people to come in and buy the cakes.

events.title: Who are the key figures in Maduro's trial?
events.description: Top trial lawyer, Barry Pollack, is going to be defending Nicolas Maduro as his legal case advances, He'll be going up before 92-year-old Judge Alvin Hellerstein. Maduro has pleaded not guilty to narcotics charges, at an initial arraignment on January 5. His next court date is set for March 17th, and the case is expected to go to trial.

events.title: Ten guilty of cyber bullying France's first lady after false transgender claims
events.description: Ten people have been found guilty of cyber bullying France's first lady Brigitte Macron.

events.title: Pope closes 2025 Holy Year and signals his pontificate can now begin in earnest
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has closed the Vatican‚Äôs 2025 Holy Year, denouncing consumerism and anti-foreigner sentiment

events.title: Finland's battle against fake news starts in preschool classrooms
events.description: Finland has been fighting fake news by teaching media literacy to children as young as 3

events.title: European leaders push back on Trump's comments about a US takeover of Greenland
events.description: Several European leaders have pushed back on U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs comments seeking an American takeover of Greenland

events.title: Driving instructors teach students to dodge danger on Zimbabwe roads
events.description: Zimbabwe‚Äôs driving lessons have shifted from test prep to survival

events.description: Ukraine's allies are meeting in Paris to discuss security guarantees after any potential peace deal with Russia

events.description: Provisional election results show Central Africa Republic President Faustin Archange Touad√©ra won a third term

events.title: Danish prime minister says a US takeover of Greenland would mark the end of NATO
events.description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen says an American takeover of Greenland would amount to the end of the NATO military alliance

events.title: Paris court finds 10 guilty of cyberbullying France‚Äôs first lady Brigitte Macron
events.description: A Paris court has found 10 people guilty of cyberbullying France‚Äôs first lady, Brigitte Macron, by spreading false online claims about her gender and sexuality, including allegations she was born a man

events.title: Holocaust survivor Eva Schloss, stepsister of Anne Frank, dies at 96
events.description: Auschwitz survivor Eva Schloss, stepsister of Anne Frank, has died at 96

events.title: Indonesia's panda cub Rio thriving 40 days after birth
events.description: Indonesia‚Äôs conservation park has shared a video of a giant panda cub named Rio, 40 days after his birth

events.title: Gaza: 100 per cent of basic food needs met for first time since 2023
events.description: For the first time since 2023, humanitarian assistance will provide Gazans with enough food to fulfil minimum nutritional needs.

events.title: UN chief condemns Israeli amendments targeting UNRWA operations
events.description: The UN Secretary-General has condemned amendments adopted by Israel‚Äôs Knesset to a law aimed at ceasing the operations of the UN agency assisting Palestine refugees (UNRWA), saying the measures must be immediately repealed.

events.title: Frantic 911 calls detail moments before Columbus dentist and wife found dead: 'There's a body'
events.description: Frantic 911 calls reveal moments before Columbus dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique were found dead with gunshot wounds, two children unharmed.

events.title: Seattle leaders slammed for police order to stop prosecuting drug users
